title: Episode 92 - Civil Rights 1950 - 60
itunes:author: The History of the Cold War Podcast
itunes:summary:
In this episode, we examine the Civil Rights Movement 1950-1960. We cover the effect of the Civil rights movement on US foreign policy, the major events of the period, and how the Eisenhower administration addressed the issue.

Please check out our sponsor for this episode and get one month free at The Great Courses Plus:
https://www.thegreatcoursesplus.com/hotcw

For pictures for this episode and more go to our website at:  www.historyofthecoldwarpodcast.com/

Want to skip the ads and get right to the content, become a patreon subscriber here: www.patreon.com/coldwarpodcast
